intro: Peridium glabratum, commonly known as the smooth peridium, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive, smooth outer covering. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like parsley and carrots, and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels.
